contentrichtext.text: '''William Mangion''' (born August 24, 1958 in [[Naxxar]]) is a [[Malta|Maltese]] [[singer]], best known for presenting Malta in the [[Eurovision Song Contest 1993]] and placing 8th out of 25 countries with ''This Time''. He is one of Malta's leading vocalist musician. Mangion will perform in the semi-final of the Maltese qualifying heat for Eurovision in 2007. In early 2011, William went to the USA, but still makes frequent visits back to Malta. {{s-start}} {{s-ach}} {{succession box| before = [[Mary Spiteri]]<br>with ''"[[Little Child (song)|Little Child]]"'' | title = [[Malta in the Eurovision Song Contest]]| years = [[Eurovision Song Contest 1993|1993]]| after = [[Chris & Moira]]<br>with ''"[[More than Love (Scicluna and Stafrace song)|More than Love]]"'' | }} {{s-end}} == External links == *[http://www.william-mangion.com William Mangion (official website)] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = hancu william mangion | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Maltese singer | DATE OF BIRTH = August 24, 1958 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Mangion, William}} [[Category:1958 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Maltese male singers]] [[Category:Malta Song for Europe contestants]] [[Category:Maltese Eurovision Song Contest entrants]] [[Category:Eurovision Song Contest entrants of 1993]] {{Malta-bio-stub}} {{Europe-singer-stub}}
